column5: Deep water lakes, way up yonder, might still be covered with ice when Saturday gets here.
A minnow trapper reported yesterday (Saturday) that his trapping block north of Pickle Lake still had ice.
Spent the day on LOTW near Kenora today, beautiful.
It's official, the Lake of the Woods was ice free on May 14th,... let the games begin!
Just got word ice is out on Cedar!
Big changes on Perrault Lake over the last few days.https://manotak.com/dock-cam/
Wabaskang is breaking up as seen on the Sleepy Dog Cabins website. Later, Jay
23 degrees tomorrow in Perrault Falls, the ice should really start melting even faster!! Hope everybody has a great season!! (Fishermen and Outfitters) Chuck
Looks like the opener is shaping up perfect.most lakes pretty much ice free in the vermilion bay area.can see some ice floating around but all that should be gone within days.
Sounds like it's time to put the "Ice Out" threads to rest.
Ice is going....slowly but melting just like every year.

Here in northern MN there are still quite a few lakes with a not insignificant amount of ice cover. Makes me wonder how things are up on Savant Lake, and how the fishing might be different this year (we go in late June) compared to other years. The hunt for fish is part of the fun!
Baskatong ice free and Cabonga will be shortly.
Pics just taken today of the Ogoki reservoir. Don Elliot, from Mattice Lake Outfitters just sent them. He feels it may be open by next weekend, we are heading up 6/1.
www.facebook.com/lakeofthewoodsmn/posts/10156370522512855
I flew from kenora to Dryden today. Hereâ€™s Vermillion Bay. The ice is starting to darken but still had a ways to go. Supposed to be 10 tomorrow, 20 Sunday and 18 Monday.

Took a nice Sunday drive up to perrault falls to see what's happening. All the small lakes like trail lake are going to be gone this week they are pure black.cedar and wabaskang are getting a darker shade to so with some warm weather we have and 3 days of rain forecasted all the right ingredients will get mixed up.walked down to the public launch on wabaskang and took a picture of gawleys and king Fisher.that part is open and lots of water coming through the falls from perrault lake.on our way back I stopped at cedar lake lodge launch and lake is also getting dark and some open water on shoreline.its 19c here today so it's softening things up.
I'm watchin the Manotak webcam and it still looks grim, but it should melt quickly with 3 days of rain!! Fingers crossed for the next 20 days!!! Chuck

Thanks to everyone for the constant ice reports last week. We ended up fishing Friday and Saturday with the ice well on its way out... the thaw is happening very fast this year. Friday the ice was still white but pretty well honeycomb for the top half, Saturday it was gray and honeycomb all the way through, and Sunday the sheet was mostly all black. We took atvs on Friday but decided to walk on Saturday. I would not be surprised to see WFB boatable by Sunday.
NICE Lakers!
Glad to see it worked out for you guys.
http://www.redwinglodge.net/webcam/ It's starting to go out! Some open water is finally here!

Yesterday was very warm and very very windy. I think it sped up the ice out a lot. 2 days ago the ice was tight to the shore and still not very dark. Yesterday evening the ice was well black and pulled away from shore 30ish feet with open holes visible further out. I talked to someone on the downwind side of canyon lake also and the said the wind was pushing the ice up onto the shore and it was crushing and piling up on the shore. We definitely needed that.
Things are looking positive up at Sportsman's Lodge on Little Vermillion Lake, just north of Red Lake.http://sportsmanslv.com/

I hope you're right, the long days and bright sun just have me a bit worried that this ice could go from mid-winter status to unsafe for atv's in a very short time frame. I'm planning to be a bit SW of you in the Sioux Narrows/Nestor Falls area. If the ice doesn't look good there we will head up to Sioux Lookout. Either way we're not far from your location so the ice conditions should be somewhat similar. Really appreciate your late season reports.

South of me will go a bit faster.was on the lake this morning till 2.came of at my buddies ramp and broke through.shorelines will be your worst enemy depending which direction they are.ill be taking the atv this weekend.sioux lookout and where I live are the same line there just east of me by 76 mi.as the crow flies.lol.maybe leave earlier.ice will be good.bring a couple of ladders.plus 12c today.forecast is warm.did good again.fished 3 diff spots released everything.nothing big all 25".
was out on Saturday with atv.good going from shore.headed out tomorrow ill let youknow my findings.was in drydenn this morning and went to the ice road by the dock.its toast.things are happening.

Seriously appreciate the updates! The melt down is definitely happening and it's going to come down to the wire for this weekend. My gut is telling me it's gonna be a no go in the Sioux Narrows area but we'll just wait and see I guess. Thanks again and good luck tomorrow.
Things are happening fast. Saw a video of a truck going through the ice in Clearwater Bay today. Stay safe.

was headed out today on cliff lake but my buddy who lives there told me his ramp is all water as of now.could get on ice on different spot but he said there was a side by side out there yesterday and was having trouble getting hung up.conditions have gone sour since I was out on Saturday and he also told me it is 24 inch thick ice but auger goes through it like butter.i have decided to call it a year.ill work on some projects I have been avoiding and get working on my boat which I hope to use shortly.
This is in front of Mylie's Place yesterday on Lake of the Woods.... Warm weather and rain are both in the forecast. Everything is looking good!!!!!!!!!!
Here is a picture in front of Redwing Wing Lodge based in Morson on LOTW. Looks like the ice is close to giving up for the season.http://www.redwinglodge.net/webcam/image.jpg PjShorthorn
Hmm, I drove up to Kabetogama in Minnesota on Sunday. They still had nearly 30" on ice on the main lake. It will be close and the small bays might be open but it's gonna be close I believe.
I believe it was much colder in Minnesota than it was in the Kenora area in late March and first parts of April. Trucks going through the ice on LOW around Kenora.

John, appreciate all your reports. Keep posting. However, don't push this thawing thing too fast. I'll be on Cliff several days of the 2nd week of the season looking for lakers and am hoping the water will still be VERY cold! If the ice goes in the middle of opening week I'd be very happy!
Believe me.the water will be cold.lol.

Here is an interesting article from up Nort on ice conditions on LOTW. It looks like it is going to be a squeaker on whether ice may still be on lakes for opening week in southern Ontario Lakes. Lakes that are further north.....http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/thunde...-ice-1.4613349 PjShorthorn
Pray for warm weather and rain; been ice fishing Eagle lake and cut new holes 2 days ago, 30" of ice!!!!!!
I check the Weather Channel every day for Red Lake CN. Here is the next 10 day forecast.https://weather.com/weather/tenday/l/CAXX0606:1:CA

The long range forecast still isn't looking good... Right now it is predicting April 27th as the first day that it doesn't get bellow freezing at night. Only gets down to 33. We need that to change. We need wind, rain, and warmth.
Might be out there.wife loves trout fishing and we usually fish for smallies with the fly rods.trout will be there.i don't troll much for them.we jig them them.

Have been out trout fishing the last few days.been 4 days since I posted here.whats happened on the lake is that most of the surface snow and slush is starting to melt.yesterday at around plus 7c was doing a good job off melting.still a few nights where we are below freezing but just barely.woll still tighten up the surface water a bit but good warm temps in the forecast.things are looking good.we have been taking the truck out and 30-40"of ice is still there so I feel pretty safe yet but it's amazing how fast that ice can go.on another note we have been doing great on lake trout and yesterday in our trout holes we caught smallmouths and walleyes to.walleyes really shouldn't be there as there far from there spawning areas.ill keep you updated on the ice every few days.got to take my son and his girlfriend out .enjoyed the finally warm weather.

Nice fish and I appreciate the ice reports, so thank you! I have a trip planned to chase lakers in your general area on the weekend of April 27-29 so I'm hoping the weather cooperates between now and then.

Long range is looking good.cant see any problems.thats just over a week away.will get really wet this week already with the melt and ice should lift soon.that would get rid of surface water.where are you headed to.bites on if you know some good spots.ill give you a update next week or earlier.headed out tomorrow for some catch and release lakers.just going to look for some big ones.smoking some up today.
Sounds perfect to me.will be guiding next week and looks like perfect ice fishing weather.

I went across the ice road in Dryden today and itâ€™s looking pretty healthy still. People are starting to pull their shacks off the lake but there are still lots out there. Itâ€™s been getting down to -20C at night still so my guess is youâ€™ll be able to get your boat on the lake for opening weekend but youâ€™ll likely be dodging icebergs. Like someone said before we need it to stay in plus temps overnight for things to really start melting.

Here on the Minnesota side of LOW, I will not be surprised if people were walking out and ice fishing on opener. It happened several years back and the ice is thick and making ice this morning as it is down to zero! 6 years ago we fished on the Rainy River and then went out in the lake and fished, in the boat on March 31st. The ice pack was out over a mile but it was funny watching people pull up to the ice pack with boats and some would hop out and take pictures. It is crazy the extremes that we see from here and north into Canada within just a few years.

Wow, hindsight being 20/20, I'm so glad (right now) that we booked an August trip. I wanted so bad to do that last week in May, or first week in June, but my uncle's schedule didn't work for those time frames. Of course, that first week in August could be the other side of our current spectrum...hot hot hot! Fingers crossed for nice weather.

Doesnâ€™t look promising for the next 2 weeks. There are some highs of +7C for a couple days but no nights that will stay above 0. I remember spring 2013 I was hired to fly a group from red lake airport to a camp on Little Vermillion lake is the helicopter because there was too much ice for the float plane to land. I believe it was opening weekend or maybe a couple days before.

I'm in Northern Wisconsin, and as of today, April 9th, we have 16"= snow in the woods, 6"-10" more coming on the weekend, and 30" of ice. I doubt we'll have open water by the May 5th opener. So, I really wonder if N. Ontario will be open on the opener on May 19th. For those of you going to Ontario this spring, I hope you get a break and we get some warm weather.

Been ice fishing the vermilion bay area pretty steady and and have 25"-35" of ice.today was the first day the snow layer on top got soft on our way home.yes there's a lot of ice but don't think anyone needs to panic yet.theres 6 plus weeks to go.ive never not had my boat in the water on the opener.close but always have had it in the week before for trout.give it till end of the month.if it gets warm,stays warm.it will be gone.

I hope you're right. I believe there is 5 1/2 weeks left before opener correct? I was looking at a site that had the latest ice out ever recorded in the last 120 years up in that area and it was May 19th. And that was in the early 1900's I believe. In 2014 I believe it was May 14th or 16th for a point of reference.
4 days ago 36" chainsaw went in the ice at Gullrock right up to the handle and came back dry. No water seeped up.

well my 4 days of guiding is over.was a fantastic week.great weather and fish were cooperating on all days.fish are behaving different and not where they are supposed to be.crappies we found on main lake deep in some holes I know of and once found very easy to catch.not anywhere were ive caught them before in other years. walleyes 25 ft.we also found 45 inches of ice on the main lake where narrower ares stayed steady at 35 inches.today it got warm on the trout lake we were on and snow is melting pretty good today.but as someone mentioned opener not far off so its going to have to stay warm.seems today there was 6 inches of frozen slush so once that's gone the ice will start going a bit faster.iam not to worried I do have a plan B and C.good luck.
if there is a record late ice out, what will that mean for fishing? going to Tamarack Island on LOTW June 4th, would that put crappie spawn into play or mess with it around that time ?
I think fishing is more dependent on water temp then the calendar. I might be wrong tho.
All about temps.
I hope it melts before our trip to Melchett in September! In the meantime you can get some good ice reports on the LOW area here https://icepatrol.wordpress.com/2018...ut-snow-cover/

I would be surprised if ice is out by walleye opener on Lake of the Woods. Just the other day Mike (Red Wing Lodge) told me they were using augers with two extensions to get through the ice. My guess is by June, it will be out.Locally, I don't think ice will be out on some lakes in the Brainerd area by May 11. Guys have told me there is at least a foot of snow on top of the ice and the ice is about 28 inches thick. And we have another week's worth of temperature below freezing with lows in the single digits. But who knows, a good heat wave and some heavy rains could change things in a hurry.Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

That just means a extended ice fishing season to me breezy.lol.but a lot can happen in the next 7 weeks till the opener.but iam betting it's gone.last time it was bad was I think 5 years ago.took a party out on eagle and headed to Osborn bay to find warmer water and we dodged huge ice flows on our way down there.but it can go very quick with the right days.i hope to be in my boat on the water before the opener for some lake trout trips and some pike.

I hope you're wrong... lots of stuff to do to get resorts going, and losing the time would make the entire year more difficult. It also would be an ENORMOUS financial loss for lodge owners to lose two weeks worth of guests.

I didn't mean to predict an ice out by June...I am sure it will be earlier than that...I just said by June because someone else said they were going up there the first week of June.That being said, where I am at, we have had 12 inches of snow since last Friday with another 2-5 predicted for today and another 3-5 in the forecast for next Sunday. All that snow is surely insulating the ice really well and I would be surprised is ice is out in Central MN by May 11 opener. In 2013 we had ice on the lakes here for opener.Of course a heat wave and some rain can change that quickly.Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

Gotcha.... Looking at the 10 day forecast, the temp doesn't look like it will be above 30 on Lake of the Woods for another week. It can go out fast once it starts, but it certainly won't be out on Lake of the Woods before early May.
Warmest day in the 14 day forecast is +4c. Here in Winnipeg it's supposed to get to 8-10c with some rain in the same period.
Anybody have an idea if ice will be gone for the ontario opener, red lake area Thanks
Got a message from Nakina yesterday. Still cold, snowing and no sign of spring. If it doesn't change soon there will be ice flowing at opener.

I've been watching the same area as I'll be joining a group on Little Vermillion (Sportsman Lodge) for the opener. I check the weather up there every day on the Weather Channel site. As of today @ 0600 -5 with a high projected @13. The next 10 day forecast does not look promising until the 9th of April.
Come visit me when you get here @ Simon's 2018 Walleye Opener Ice Auger Sales and Rental Service.

I pulled a satellite image from yesterday and eyeballed where the ice lines were for western great lakes and lower ontario. Right now everything north of a petosky mi to minneapolis mn line is iced in solid. we will see in weeks to come how much that line moves north.

The ice and opener should be interesting this spring.as usually there will be open water.some areas will have more.this first week of April coming up in the vermilion bay area will have night time temps that will be making ice.i have been ice fishing last few days and ice is rumbling and cracking meaning it's still making ice.going to need above 0 nights to start loosing some ice and daytime temps need to get higher to do any damage to snow pack.everywhere I have been seems like ice is 30-35"thick and up to a foot of hard snow on top with some slush frozen in.some of the best ice fishing yet to come.so 7 weeks to the opener.doesnt sound like much time but once the weather turns it's amazing how fast it goes.

IT was -15C when I drove my wife to work this morning here in Winnipeg. Was ice fishing in a shallow bay on Lake Winnipeg two weeks ago and the ice was 5' thick. We had extreme cold for an extended period in December without snow which has made the ice really thick. Hopefully it will get warm.
This is shaping up to be a record late ice out. Still more than 3 feet of ice on LOTW's and 20" of compacted snow on top of it.
Start doing a rain dance! Nothing kills ice faster then rain, sun , light breeze.

In 1996 we were on our way up to Lac Seul for the opening week. We got to Duluth and Lake Superior still had a lot of ice on it!!! We knew we were in trouble. Got to Sioux Lookout and although the bay where we picked up the houseboat in Hudson was open, the rest of the lake heading north wasn't navigable. We sat at the dock for two full days and on the second night , one heck of a storm came through throwing guys out of their top bunks in the middle of the night. We were able to leave the dock the next day as the ice quickly started to sink,but we only made it halfway up to our intended destination before we decided to tie off for the rest of the trip. It was really an errie feeling hearing the ice bounce off the houseboat pontoons. PjShorthorn
